This app provides real-time GPS coordinates to your camera via Bluetooth, allowing for automatic geotagging of your photos without needing the camera\'s built-in GPS.
Check the app logs in the top menu for troubleshooting information, or review your device settings to ensure all permissions are granted.
How do I connect my camera to the app?

1. Make sure your camera supports Bluetooth connectivity and GPS tagging
2. Enable Bluetooth on your phone
3. Tap 'Add Camera Device' to start the pairing process
4. Follow the on-screen instructions to pair your camera. Reboot your camera after the first pairing process.
Why isn\'t my camera appearing in the list?

• Ensure your camera is in pairing/Bluetooth mode
• Check that your camera supports the required Bluetooth profile
• Make sure you're within range (typically 10 meters)
• Try restarting Bluetooth on your phone
How do I enable the service permanently?

To keep GPS data syncing with your camera:
1. Go to your device's Settings > Apps
2. Find 'CameraGPS' in the app list
3. Tap on it and select 'Battery'
4. Choose 'Don't optimize' or 'Allow background activity'
5. This prevents the system from stopping the GPS service

You can also access this through the device details page in the app.
My camera does not connect automatically, what can I do?

Unfortunately, there might be situations, where the automatic connection does not work. If you encounter issues please do the following: On the main screen, tap on your camera to open the details screen. There you have an option to enable the "Always On" mode, which will keep the app in the foreground
What permissions does the app need?

The app requires:
• Location permissions (for GPS data)
• Bluetooth permissions (to connect to camera)
• Battery optimization exemption (for continuous service)
• Nearby devices permission (for device discovery)
How accurate is the GPS data?

GPS accuracy depends on:
• Satellite visibility (better outdoors)
• Weather conditions
• Your phone's GPS capabilities
• Typical accuracy is 3-5 meters under good conditions
Does the app work in the background?

Yes, once properly configured:
• The service runs in the background to maintain GPS sync
• Make sure to disable battery optimization
• The app will show a persistent notification when active
• GPS data is continuously sent to your connected camera
My camera disconnects frequently. What can I do?

Try these solutions:
• Keep your phone closer to the camera
• Disable battery optimization for the app
• Check if your camera has power saving modes that affect Bluetooth
• Restart both devices and re-pair if necessary

To ensure reliable GPS sync with your camera, please disable battery optimization for this app. This prevents the system from limiting background activity. You can also choose to ignore this dialog and the app may function just as fine. This heavily depends on the device manufacturer and Android version

Xiaomi devices require additional steps to ensure the app works reliably in the background:

1. Open Battery Optimization settings
2. Set this app to "Don't optimize"
3. Go to Settings > Apps > Manage apps
4. Find this app and enable "Autostart"
5. Set "Background app limits" to "No restrictions"

On the next screen, follow the instructions to pair your camera. Once pairing is complete, the app will automatically connect to your camera and start transmitting location data. If it does not start immediately, try restarting your camera.

If the default connection mode does not work, you can enable Always On mode after pairing your device. Tap the device entry on the main screen and turn on the toggle. This mode may use more battery, but only transmits location data when connected to the camera.
